content.description:
Start on easy ground and clip a bolt. Technical climbing ramps up as you climb past the middle of the wall. Several ''trust non existant feet'' moves see you past a tricky crux to a savior undercling. Easy ''don't blow it ground'' seperates you from the anchor.

Second route from the right. Very obvious black streak.
4 bolts. Lower off the anchor at the top.

Start right behind the tree. Hard friction off the deck (might want to stick-clip because of the tree) to more technical smearing. At mid-height, there is the posibility of a reassuring nut placement in a flake.

6th bolt line from the left.
3 bolts + set of nuts. Bolted anchor.

Climb up to a very high first bolt (potential for some good gear placements), then climb on good holds until you hit a small, interesting hueco. Figure out the techy / balancy / crappy feet /crappy hands crux. Surmount the exciting exit and finish on good (compared to the rest) holds to the anchor. Very stiff for the grade.

Second bolted line from the left.
4 bolts. Optional medium size gear for the start if you aren't comfortable. Bolted anchor.

Climb the sweet pink dike to the face above. Cool moves lead you to an exciting and steeper finish.

4th bolt line from the left.
4-5 bolts.

will add later*
  • will add later*
  • will add later*

Start just left of the tree that grows near the base of the cliff. Hard body tension /smearing  straight off the deck that dosen't let up. Spicy clipping the second bolt. The remainder looks just as blank.

5th bolt line from the left.
5 bolts. Bolted anchor.

Climb up over broken ground (easy) to a very high first bolt. Keep climbing on good holds until the angle steepens ; a tricky and balancy friction crux awaits. The fall potential is exciting, but safe. Finish on relatively good holds to the top. Stiff for the grade.

Left-most route.
3 bolts. Bolted anchor.

Committing moves off the deck lead to an honestly placed first bolt. Follow up the bolt line directly right of Ethics Police. The crux is at the top and goes at about 5.9, that is, if you take the path of least resistance. Finishing directly up the slab to the anchor is 5.11.

3rd bolt line from the left.
5 bolts. Bolted anchor.

Short warm-up / easy route. Nice holds / jugs lead to a smearing crux at the end. Nice but short. Would be a good begginer lead.

Last bolt line to the right of the cliff.
3 bolts. Bolted anchor.

Eastern Bloc is a sweet chunk of granite located right next to the Twin Ribs (just right of Down Under). The climbing is all low angle to off-vertical.  
  
 The rock is very strange... In a good way! A mix of slab, tiny holds, huge jugs and even a hueco and some small pockets. The easier climbs here are mostly climbing on good holds for the bottom half, but as you get up higher the holds disappear and then there is usually some sort of tricky / inobvious friction crux. The harder lines are straight up hard friction the whole way; blank-looking, improbable, and bold. 
  
 If you want to master this tricky subset of climbing (slab) and you are in the Ottawa area, look no further than Eastern Bloc. Note : Unless otherwise stated, the grades here are almost always on the stiff side.
